title: Rising Agricultural Sector and Green Initiatives Fuel Adoption of CTO Derivatives in Bio-Based Products - Yahoo Finance
summary: The global Crude Tall Oil Derivative market is projected to reach US$ 2.5 Billion by 2028, reflecting a robust Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) of 4.4% during the period from 2023 to 2028. Key factors driving the growth of the CTO Derivative market include the rising demand for value-added bio-based products, sustainable green approaches, agricultural sector growth, versatile usage, and recycling and collaborations. Key players in the CTO Derivative market include Forchem Oyj (Respol Resinas S.A.), Ingevity Corporation, Kraton Corporation (DL Chemical Co. Ltd.), Les Derives Resiniques Et Terpeniques (Firmenich International SA), Mercer International Inc., Neste Oyj, Pine Chemical Group Oy, Segezha Group, Silver Fern Chemical Inc., SunPine AB, and Univar Solutions Inc.
green_innovation: TRUE. CTO derivatives are made from renewable, bio-based materials and offer environmental benefits such as a lower carbon footprint and reduced environmental impact during usage and disposal.
business_innovation: TRUE. CTO derivatives are used in a variety of new or improved products and processes, such as fuel additives, surfactants, and coatings, that offer significant benefits over previous products or processes.
green_product: TRUE. CTO derivatives are used in a variety of green products, such as biofuels, bio-based plastics, and eco-friendly cleaning products, that offer environmental benefits over traditional products.
green_process: TRUE. CTO derivatives are produced using sustainable green processes that minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability, such as using renewable resources and reducing waste.
